From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To define and enable a message-of-the-day (MOTD) banner, use the **banner motd** command in global configuration mode. To delete the MOTD banner, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Delimiting character of your choice—a pound sign (#), for example. You cannot use the delimiting character in the banner message.
Message text. You can include tokens in the form $(*token*) in the message text. Tokens will be replaced with the corresponding configuration variable.

Examples: The following example configures an MOTD banner. The pound sign (#) is used as a delimiting character.
Router# banner motd # Building power will be off from 7:00 AM until 9:00 AM this coming
The following example configures an MOTD banner with a token. The percent sign (%) is used as a delimiting character.
Enter TEXT <message>. End with the character '%'.
Notice: all routers in $(domain) will be upgraded beginning April 20
When the MOTD banner is executed, the user will see the following. Notice that the $(<token>) syntax is replaced by the corresponding configuration variable.
Notice: all routers in ourdomain.com will be upgraded beginning April 20
ExtraInfo: Follow this command with one or more blank spaces and a delimiting character of your choice. Then enter one or more lines of text, terminating the message with the second occurrence of the delimiting character.This MOTD banner is displayed to all terminals connected and is useful for sending messages that affect all users (such as impending system shutdowns). Use the **no****exec-banner** or **no****motd-banner** command to disable the MOTD banner on a line. The **no****exec-banner** command also disables the EXEC banner on the line.When a user connects to the router, the MOTD banner appears before the login prompt. After the user logs in to the router, the EXEC banner or incoming banner will be displayed, depending on the type of connection. For a reverse Telnet login, the incoming banner will be displayed. For all other connections, the router will display the EXEC banner.To customize the banner, use tokens in the form $(*token*) in the message text. Tokens will display current Cisco IOS configuration variables, such as the router's host name and IP address. The tokens are described in [Table 16](#wp1014588).Table 16 banner motd Tokens| Token | Information Displayed in the Banner || --- | --- || **$(hostname)** | Displays the host name for the router. || **$(domain)** | Displays the domain name for the router. || **$(line)** | Displays the vty or tty (asynchronous) line number. || **$(line-desc)** | Displays the description attached to the line. |
